attributes.title: Physical stock verification
attributes.description:
The table below shows the summary of the stock findings

·           The following were the stock findings;

ü  Yeast-       -125g.

ü  Bread -     -47.25loaves

ü  Cumulative variance in polybags was +128 pieces

ü  All other materials had either zero or negligible variances.
attributes.recommendation: ·           The management to ensure that the set stock controls are consistently adhered to avoid stock variances.
attributes.effect: Minimal variances noted in stock items is an indication that stock controls are being observed.

value: ·           Strong internal controls will be maintained.
Control is ok and will maintain the trend
·           May 2025 audit report highlighted that physical stock verified on 17.05.2025 showed polybags shortfall of 504pcs and surplus yeast stock of 250g.
Previous

·           A stock take exercise was conducted on 14.06.25 to assess the effectiveness of internal controls that are put in place to safeguard company assets such as the production materials and the finished products.
+ Minimal item variation was noted hence strong internal controls.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring available physical stock match book balances.

attributes.title: Dough weight analysis.
attributes.description:
·          The below table shows analysis of dough weights sampled on 15/06/2025;

Dough weights sampled on 07.06.2025:(2 shift @04.50pm)

ü  Dough weights showed high underweight rate.
attributes.recommendation: ·         Standard set dough dividing weights should be adhered to in order to ensure production of standard weight bread.
attributes.effect: + Underweight dough samples result to underweight bread which expose the company to penalties if intercepted at the market by relevant regulatory authorities.

value: ·         We will enhance spot checks to ensure dough dividing adheres to set standard weights to check extreme bread weights.
·         Frequent monitoring will be enforced to ensure adherence to set standard dough dividing weights..
Packed bread weighed on 17.05.25 showed several underweight dough samples
Previous
·         Sample varieties of dough  were randomly picked and weighed to establish whether the branch adheres to weights and measures standards.
+ Underweight bread was noted meaning noncompliance to set standard weights.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring dough is divided at set standard dough weights.

attributes.title: Packed bread weight analysis
attributes.description: ·         Bread weights were sampled on 14/06/2025 and the following below were the results.
attributes.recommendation:
·         Standard set dough dividing weights should be adhered to in order to ensure production of standard weight bread.

+      Packers’ efficiency is also crucial in ensuring that bread packing is timely to prevent bread from overcooling.
attributes.effect:
·         Under and overweight bread presence suggests inconsistency in dough dividing as justified by dough weights sampled.

·         Overweight bread lowers yield targets hence withholding revenue targets.

+      Presence of underweight bread exposes the company to risks of fines and penalties from regulatory bodies.

value:
·         We will enhance spot checks to ensure dough dividing adheres to set standard weights to check extreme bread weights.

+ Packers will be closely monitored to ensure timely bread packing to address underweight bread.
More controls on weight will be put to address the observed overweight loaves.
Packed bread weighed on 17.05.25 showed high underweight bread samples.
Previous
·         Sample varieties of  packed bread were randomly picked and weighed to establish whether the branch adheres to weights and measures standards.
+ Packed underweight bread was noted hence noncompliance to set standard packed bread weights.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring production of standard weight bread.

attributes.title: Bread damages analysis
attributes.description:
PRODUCTION DAMAGE ANALYSIS:

·          Production damage rate is tabulated below.

MARKET DAMAGE ANALYSIS:

·          Market damage rate is tabulated below.
attributes.recommendation:
·          The management should focus on efforts to address high production damages to ensure that the company doesn’t lose revenues.

·          Control of production and market damages is commendable.
attributes.effect: + Having bread damages within the tolerable limits implies that the company is not exposed to losses and revenue targets were realized.

value: + Strict adherence to the production process will be implemented to ensure that bread damages are minimized to very low levels.
+ We will continue to maintain bread damages at minimal levels.
+ May 2025 audit report highlighted high production damages rate (at 0.28% of total loaves produced) as analyzed from 16.04.25 – 16.05.25.
Previous

·          The test was conducted to determine the extent of damages produced during production and those replaced as market damages and find out if they were within expected/set limits. High damages suggest bread of inferior quality produced.

·          Production damage rate allowed is 0.2% of total production while market damage allowed is 0.5% of net sales.
+ Bread damages at the branch were maintained within the tolerable rates hence compliant with set bread damage control policies.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring bread damages are controlled within the tolerable levels.

attributes.title: Broken bread damages (sent to ingredients)-Analysis
attributes.description:
·           As per the records, there was 711 kg of bread damages that was to be sent to ingredients department.

·           A total of 589.6kg was sent over the same period hence the expected physical balance was 121.4kg.

·           On the spot-check day 124.2kg of bread damages was found giving a variance of 2.8kg (+7loaves).

 Below is a summary of the findings
attributes.recommendation: ·           The branch management should ensure that all bread damages are properly accounted for as observed.
attributes.effect: Minimal variance noted implies there was accountability of bread damages.

value: We will always ensure control of bread damages.
Broken bread damages sent to ingredient department will always be properly managed.
+ Bread damages were properly accounted for form 01/01/25 – 03/02/25.
Previous
+ Bread damages recorded from 01/06/2025 – 14/06/2025 was compared with the damages sent and the physical damages in the branch to identify if the branch accounted for all bread damages.
+ Broken bread damages destined for ingredients department were well accounted for as per set SOPs.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring all broken bread damages to ingredient department are properly accounted for.

attributes.title: Mixing charts/summaries analysis
attributes.description:
Below are the summary of the findings

17.05.25 – 13.06.25:

·          The above table shows that;

·          There was no significant variance between system and the actual material consumption.

·          Correct posting was also noted over the audited period.
attributes.recommendation: + The branch should continue observing the set consumption and production standards.
attributes.effect: + Consumption and production set standards were observed and this implies proper accountability of raw materials and finished goods.

value: ·           This is noted and will be maintained.
+ We will strengthen document accuracy to ensure that accurate information is conveyed on registers and SAP system.
+ May 2025 audit report highlighted that actual raw material consumption quantities as per manual mixing charts matched that of SAP system as analyzed from 16.04.25 – 16.05.25.
Previous
+ Comparison of manual mixing charts and the system mixing charts was done from 17.05.25 – 13.06.25 to find out if accurate transfer of production data was being done.
+ Production records were matching for all production details and data was accurately transferred from production records to the SAP system.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring data from source documents i.e. mixing charts/summaries is transferred accurately to the SAP accounting system.

attributes.title: Muster Roll Analysis.
attributes.description: Analysis of muster rolls from 21.05.25 - 16.06.25 showed staff worked for more than 6days consecutively.
attributes.recommendation: + The branch management should ensure that staff don't work continuously for more than 6days by proper prior planning and ensure set duty rosters are adhered to.
attributes.effect:
+ Staff working for prolonged period may become worn out and inefficient.

+ Overworking of staff may result to accidents at work place.

+ Unpaid overtime for staff working for prolonged period may expose the company to unnecessary liabilities.

value:
+ Shortage of staff resulted to staff working for more days than allowed.

+ One of the Charge Hand Bakers relieved branch manager resulting to shortfall of C.H.Bs hence the available ones working for more days than required.

+ Staff shortage led to available staff working for more than 6days continuously.

+ We are in the process of hiring mostly relievers for turn men and drivers to ensure working days policy is adhered to.
N/A
Current

+ Permanent and casual muster rolls were analyzed to check if staff worked within the specified days and shifts. i. e. not more than 1shift or more than 6days continuously.  Analysis was done from 21.05.25 - 16.06.2025.
+ Staff at the branch worked continuously for more than 6days against set policy.
Human Resource Department
+ Ensuring staff do not work continuously for more than 1shift or 6days.

attributes.title: Mini shop spot check analysis.
attributes.description:
·          Mini shop spot check was conducted on 14.06.2025.

·         The shop attendant accounted for all the bread loaded.

·         All sales were made through Mpesa till.

·         The below table shows details of mini shop transactions.
attributes.recommendation: The Mini shop attendant should keep up with the noted good stock and cash control.
attributes.effect: + Mini shop SOPs are adhered to hence minimal risk of bread and crates loss.

value: We shall maintain control at the mini shop.
Controls on mini shop to be maintained.
Mini shop SOPs were adhered to as per spot check done on 17.05.2025.
Previous
·          A spot check was conducted in the mini shop to assess whether their operations were being carried out in accordance with the established standards.
+ Bread and crates and the mini shop were accounted for and mini shop SOPs were followed.
Sales Department
+ Ensuring that bread and crates at the mini shop are properly accounted for and all bread are accompanied by valid STNs.

attributes.title: Bread yield analysis
attributes.description:
·          From 17/05/2024 – 13/06/2025, aggregate yield (after conversion to 400g) ranged from 191.73 – 192.48lvs/bag, with an average of 192.15lvs/bag.

·          From 2,702bags, total yield expected was 519,198pcs (upon conversion to 400g) and 519,198pcs was reflected on production records. Thus, expected yields realized.

·          Breakdown of yields for the various bread varieties is tabulated below;
attributes.recommendation: ·         Noted realization of yield targets is commendable.
attributes.effect: + Revenue targets were realized.

value: We will ensure set yields are always produced and recorded.
We will maintain this trend by ensuring set standard yields are always adhered to.
May 2025 audit report highlighted that set yield standards were realized as analyzed from 16.04.25 – 16.05.2025.
Previous

·          The exercise was conducted to determine if resulting yields for each variety matched expected yields (as per set BOMs) and also establish the consistency. Low yields than expected would be translated as concealing of actual yields denying the company revenues.
+ Set standard bread yields were adhered to hence compliance with set standards.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring that set yields are realized/achieved are accurately transferred to SAP system.

attributes.title: Outstanding customer debts analysis.
attributes.description: ·         Outstanding debts for customers was Kshs. 10,594.00 while that of institutions was 514,766.00.
attributes.recommendation: ·         Sales crew and the sales representative to ensure that bread supplied is paid for on delivery for customers without credit arrangement.
attributes.effect: High unsecured outstanding debts exposes the company to a great risk of bad debts.

value:
Sales representative comments:

+ The minimal debts noted for individual customers will be followed up and cleared.

+ Institutions payments are managed from the head office.

Sales representative comments:

+ The minimal debts noted for individual customers will be followed up and cleared.

+ Institutions payments are managed from the head office.
+ Outstanding customer debts were highlighted on May 2025 audit report.
Previous
·         Analysis of the branch outstanding balances as at 14th June 2025 for routes was done to determine the debtors’ value and if the company is exposed to bad debts.
+ outstanding customer balances was noted meaning policy of no credit terms was not complied with.
Sales Department
+ Ensuring that all deliveries are paid in cash terms and no credit sales terms.

attributes.title: Production efficiency analysis
attributes.description: ·          Analysis was done from 17/05/2025 - 13/06/2025. Production efficiency is tabulated below;
attributes.recommendation: + Branch management should ensure proper planning is put in place to ensure set standard production efficiency is realized.
attributes.effect: + Production inefficiency during May 2025 increased production costs.

value:
+ Production inefficiency during May 2025 was due to shift cuts on 17/05/26 (3rd shift), 19/05/25 (3rd shift) and 22/05/25 (3rd shift).

+ Set standard production efficiency was however achieved during June 2025 and stands at 4.52bags/staff of averange.
+ We had frequent shift cuts during May which affected set production efficiency standard but during June production efficiency is as per set standards.
+ May 2025 audit report highlighted packing and production inefficiency i.e. 93.6crates/packer and 4.37bags/staff as analyzed from 16.04.25 – 16.05.25.
Previous

·          This test was conducted to determine if set production  efficiency was adhered to. Low efficiency would indicate increased production costs.

·          Standard production efficiency is 4.5bags/staff.
+ Production efficiency was not realized during the month of May 2025, however, during June 2025, set production efficiency standard was realized hence compliance to set policies.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring that set production efficiency standard is achieved to check production costs.

attributes.title: Packing efficiency analysis.
attributes.description: ·          Packing efficiency (17/05/2025 – 13/06/25) is tabulated below;
attributes.recommendation:
·          Branch management should ensure proper planning is put in place to ensure set standard packing efficiency is realized.

·          Surplus payments due to packing inefficiency should be surcharged.

value:
·          We will put in necessary measures to address packing inefficiency.

+      Packers to be strictly supervised for an improved efficiency going forward.
+ Noted Packing inefficiency will be addressed.
+ May 2025 audit report highlighted packing and production inefficiency i.e. 93.6crates/packer and 4.37bags/staff as analyzed from 16.04.25 – 16.05.25.
Previous

·          This test was conducted to determine if set  packing efficiency was adhered to. Low efficiency would indicate increased production costs.

·          Packing efficiency was set at 1455pcs/person/8hr shift.
+ Set standard packing efficiency of 97crates/packer was not achieved hence noncompliance to operational efficiency policies.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring set standard packing efficiency of 97crates/packer is achieved in order to check production costs.

attributes.title: Motor vehicle fuel consumption standard rate analysis
attributes.description: ·           Motor vehicle fuel consumption standards is as follows;
attributes.recommendation: + Having set standard fuel consumption rates for sales vans is commendable.
attributes.effect: + Having set fuel consumption rate foe vans makes determining fuel quantity purchase for vans easy and checks high fuel consumption.

value: + All sales vans have set fuel consumption rates done by KAF and periodically reviewed.
+ All sales vans have set fuel consumption rates done by KAF and periodically reviewed.
+ May 2025 audit report highlighted that each sales van had set fuel consumption rate.
Previous

+ Motor vehicle mileage register was verified to check if sales vans had set fuel consumption rates done by KAF. The rates are important in determining the fuel quantity to be awarded to vans deepending on distance covered to avoin fuel overconsumption.
+ Sales motor vehicles had set fuel consumption rates as per set policies.
Transport/Fleet Department
+ Ensuring that all sales vans have set standard fuel consumption rates from KAF and ensuring that they are periodically reviewed.

attributes.title: Motor vehicle mileage and fuel consumption analysis
attributes.description: + Analysis for motor vehicle fuel consumption was carried out from 01/05/2025 – 31/05/2025 and results were analyzed on the below table
attributes.recommendation: ·          Noted economical fuel consumption for most sales vans is commendable.
attributes.effect: Economical fuel consumption by sales vans checked operation costs.

value: + Daily monitoring of vans is always ensured to observe fuel consumption set policies.
·          We will maintain the observed trend.
+ May 2025 audit report highlighted economical fuel consumption for sales vans.
Previous

·           The exercise was carried out to determine if fuel consumption quantities by sales vans  was at par with those provided on the revised permanent file. High fuel consumption would read increased operation costs.
+ Sales vans fuel consumption was economical.
Transport/Fleet Department
+ Ensuring motor vehicle fuel consumption is economical.

attributes.title: Generator fuel consumption analysis
attributes.description:
Generator fuel consumption.

·           Generator fuel consumption from 01/06/2025 – 17/06/2025.

·           Below is a tabular illustration of generator consumption.

GENERATOR : (01/06/25 - 17/06/25)
attributes.recommendation: + The branch management should liaise with KAF in order to set a standard consumption rate for the generator to enable monitoring generator fuel consumption.
attributes.effect: + Generator fuel consumption was not determined sine standard consumption rate was not provided.

value: + We always enquire from head office (from person managing Telematic system) on the quantity to purchase and all purchased fuel is drained into the generator.
+ We will contact KAF and request for them to provide standard fuel consumption rate for the generator.
+ Test not done during May 2025 audit.
Current

·           The exercise was carried out to determine if fuel consumption quantities by  generators was at par with those provided on the revised permanent file. High fuel consumption would read increased operation costs.
+ Generator had no set standard fuel consumption rate.
Transport/Fleet Department
+ Ensuring generator has set standard fuel consumption rate and ensure generator fuel consumption is economical.

attributes.title: Generator fuel filling analysis.
attributes.description:
+ Generator fuel quantity fillings on generator register was compared to Telematic system fillings to check if there were variances.

+ Analysis was done from 1st April 2025 - 17th June 2025.

+ Variations in fuel fillings was noted as per analysis table below.
attributes.recommendation:
+  After filling fuel, person managing the telematic system should flag any varaition noted real time inorder to check noted variations.

+ Variation in fuel filling quantities between generator register and tracking system should be explained.
attributes.effect: + 201 ltrs of fuel was not accounted for.

value: + All fuel purchased is filled into the generator.

+ We will contact the person manning the Telematic system to check if the tracker has an issue because we always ensure no fuel balance is left and all purchased quantity is filled into the generator.
This test was not done during the previous audit visit.
Current

+ Generator register fuel filled was compared to fillings on the Telematic system to check if there were variations.

+ Variations were flagged.

+ Variations were noted between fuel filling quantities on the generator book and those of Telematic system.

+ Generator fuel (200ltrs) could not be accounted for.
Transport/Fleet Department
+ Ensuring fuel filling quantities on generator register match those of Telematic system.
